metadata.dc:author: González Martín, F
García Berrocal, J R
Pinilla Urraca, M
Ramírez-Camacho, R
López Cortijo, C
metadata.dc:description: Cellular and/or humoral immune reactions may be involved in the development of some cochleovestibular dysfunctions long considered idiopathic. In a clinical study of 98 patients, 82 of them with cochleovestibular disorder, a battery of immunologic studies was used. Thirty-one patients received steroid treatment, of which 19 obtained good results; 5 of these patients had positive serum antibodies.
metadata.dc:title: Patología de oído interno de probable origen autoinmune y su respuesta al tratamiento esteroideo.
[Inner ear diseases of probable autoimmune origin and its response to steroid treatment].
